intro: Spigelia blanchetiana var. hatschbachii, commonly known as the Hatschbach's spiderling, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has lance-shaped leaves with a dark green upper surface. Its flowers, which are usually red or orange, are adapted for pollination by specific insects. This variant is distinguished by its unique floral morphology and habitat preferences.
